1.content:
'Welcome to Mirror Life. Here, you can quite literally find yourself if you want to. Just remember, there is no turning back now.'

'Wait, what?' you exclaim.
Trying to put the phone down, you are shocked when you can't move the phone from your head!

'You must now go through with this. That's simply part of how we operate. Now, your current gender is, male right? After all, our products have been tested, and so far have only worked on the male gender, including the disability of putting the phone down.'

'Uh, yeah, I guess. But what exactly is this?'

'This is Mirror Life.You will be transported to a parallel universe to ours, and meet yourself in that world. Then it's up to you to decide-'

'Wait? How is that even possible?' you cry out.

'I don't think that matters now, does it? You'll just have to go through with this. Now pick a gender for yourself, and a gender for the you that you'll meet."

'Uh, right.'

'Oh and one more thing. If you chose both yourself and the other being of yourself to be the same gender, you'll look exactly alike. And you'll both look similar if you chose opposite genders as well. Try not to freak out yourselves, okay?'

(First gender is for the main character, second is for the alternate being of himself in the parallel universe, in case that wasn't clear enough.)
1.title: The Call

11.content:
'I choose... myself to be male,' you say slowly.

'Ah, good. And about the "other" you?' says the voice on the phone.

'That person will be male, I think.'

'Well, you think correctly then. Just don't scare yourself, or your alternate self, okay? And you'll probably have to explain why there's now two of you.
Remember that.'
'Right.' You respond quickly, not really listening.

'Okay. Well, we'll start to transport you in 3... 2... 1... No-'

The voice on the line is cut off as you are suddenly thrown into a wormhole, linking the two universes together. The place itself is enough to remove all doubt from your mind. It's definitely real, you think to yourself. But what about my parents? Won't they notice I'm gone?

As if in response, a projected image on the side of the wormhole starts showing your mother coming down the stairs. It's fairly easy to deduce that this was right after the call, as the phone hangs in the air.

Huh? How could anyone have used this phone? I'm the only one here.

You recognize this as her thoughts, but not because her mouth wasn't moving. In fact, you don't know how you know. You just do.
On the screen, your mother now opens your room.
Hmm. I think this guest room needs to be redecorated.
This final though before the projection stopped removed the worry from your mind. Your parents forgot they ever had a son, and you assume everyone else in your world did too.

At this point, you suddenly (read: hitting the end of the wormhole, if that's even possible) get thrown out into the alternate universe.You recognize the area around you as your backyard. You know where you are, at least.

Well, time to explore my new home. Which will probably be extremely similar to my old one.
Before you can, however, a voice behind you says, 'Who are you?'

You turn around, and the person is...
11.title: Male/Male

choices: Try to make peace with your family
Run away and start over new
111.content:
Looking behind you, you see your clone staring right at you with the same fearful eyes. This didn't feel right at all.

"Hey, mom...MOM!" You couldn't imagine the shock on your own face. His mom, your mom, opens the backdoor and screams.

"JOE? Joe get down here!"

Your father clambers out the back door past your mother and then turns rigid. "Oh dear God, sweet Jesus...I'll be right back..." You see your father turn around and run back through the house, no doubt going to grab the shotgun from under his bed where he always kept it. Your instincts kicked in and you started sprinting as fast as you could.

"NO HE'S GETTING AWAY!" You could hear your doppelganger shouting after you. The explosion of shotgun rounds followed seconds later.

Only when you had run as far as your lungs could carry you, deep in the woods behind all the houses, did you allow yourself to collapse. The tears ran quickly down your face, emotion overcoming all reason. It felt like a living nightmare. You had to leave now or at least get somewhere safe for the time being. Your own family was attempting to hunt you down.
111.title: The alternate version of youself

12.content:
'I choose... myself to be male,' you say slowly.

'Ah, good. And about the "other" you?' says the voice on the phone.

'That person will be female, I think.'

'Well, you think correctly then. This is our most popular choice, male meets female. Well, we'll start to transport you in 3... 2... 1... No-'

The voice on the line is cut off as you are suddenly thrown into a wormhole, linking the two universes together. The place itself is enough to remove all doubt from your mind. It's definitely real, you think to yourself. But what about my parents? Won't they notice I'm gone?

As if in response, a projected image on the side of the wormhole starts showing your mother coming down the stairs. It's fairly easy to deduce that this was right after the call, as the phone hangs in the air.

Huh? How could anyone have used this phone? I'm the only one here.

You recognize this as her thoughts, but not because her mouth wasn't moving. In fact, you don't know how you know. You just do.
On the screen, your mother now opens your room.
Hmm. I think this guest room needs to be redecorated.
This final though before the projection stopped removed the worry from your mind. Your parents forgot they ever had a son, and you assume everyone else in your world did too.

At this point, you suddenly (read: hitting the end of the wormhole, if that's even possible) get thrown out into the alternate universe.You recognize the area around you as your backyard. You know where you are, at least.

Well, time to explore my new home. Which will probably be extremely similar to my old one.
Before you can, however, a voice behind you says, 'Who are you?'

You turn around, and the person is...
12.title: The Wormhole

choices: She still thinks your on drugs
She kicks you in the nuts, and calls the cops
121.content:
"Hm? Oh, you must be the "other" me." You say, "Cause you kinda look like me."

She looked at you as if you were on drugs or something, "O.k.....That's pretty creepy."

As a comeback, you explain to her the strange mirror world thing on the phone and that this was an alternate universe, but will she believe you?
121.title: The alternate version of youself

1212.content:
"Hey what kind of crazy guy are you? Where did you come from suddenly? Are you on drugs?" she asked.

Hmm... she must be my alternate, because that is exactly the same thing I would have asked, you think.

You try again to explain that this is true and you came here through a wormhole. After some seconds of thinking she finally believes you.

I wouldn't have expected anything else, at least she is me... kind of.

"What do you want?" she asks another question…
1212.title: She still thinks your on drugs

12123.content:
"The usual things- money, fame, power. Though I'll settle for being able to make this joke once again."

You could almost hear the alternate you blink. "Well," she said, "if you aren't me, you're doing a really good impression. Pretty sure I'm the only one who ever makes that joke."

"And I bet you do it all the time."

"At least once a week," she laughed. "Alright, for the time being, let's say I believe you. First, let's go inside, then you can tell me what's going on."

You appreciate that she didn't feel the need to offer any threats, since that's what you'd have done in her situation. Although, maybe she wouldn't have in the first place? Would being born and raised female as opposed to male have really made that much difference to how you turned out? "Well, guess there's only one way to find out," you think as you follow female-you inside your not-house.

******

Your alternate world parents certainly had the same decorating sense, at least. Beige walls were nearly invisible under the fight for space being carried out by family photos and wildlife art. China cabinets stood full of antiques, and the World's Ugliest Plaid Couch dominated the wall by your not-Mom's piano.

Seriously, constantly needing to remind yourself that this wasn't your universe was going to be irritating.

You followed female-you into the kitchen. Knowing without even asking, she grabbed two cans of Mountain Dew from the fridge and chucked one at you. She took a sip from her drink as she looked you up and down. "Alright, let's hear your spiel."

You take a moment to collect your thoughts. "Well, to start with, my name is Charles James. You'd be Charlotte, I'm guessing?"

"Nope. Esther Meredith."

"Esther!?" You were slightly shocked at that realization. "Why would... wait... oh my God, Mom named us after Great-Grandma Baker."

"Bingo," Esther responded as you rubbed the bridge of your nose in irritation.

"How did she ever get Dad to agree to that?"

"Damned if I know. I'm sure there's lots of lovely women named Esther. Unfortunately, they're dead," Esther quipped.

"Alright, moving on." Anymore thought on this subject would beyond doubt prove fruitless. "Back in my world, I have a younger sister, Melody, two years my junior."

"Same."

"We had a cat named Smokie, and a dog-"

"Wait, what about Evan?" Esther interrupted.

"Who?"

"Our younger brother, Evan."

"I don't have a younger brother back in my world." Well, this was a bit of a mystery. Why had your alternate parents had another kid? Unless...

Your female counterpart beat you to the punch. "It'll have been Dad. He wanted a son to carry on the family name. Because you- well, I guess, we- were born male in your world, in his mind, he'd already achieved what he needed to. He always thought three or more kids was too many. Mom would have been the one pushing for a girl."

"Yeah," you sigh, "that sounds like Dad's logic alright." You loved your old man dearly, but he could be very old fashioned sometimes.

"But yeah," Esther continued as she finished off her drink. "Cat, Smokie, asshole. Dog, Georgie, psycho. Love'em both to death. Now, how did you get here?"

You proceeded to walk your female self through your journey- the weird phone call, the questions, getting pulled into this world, your own mother forgetting your very existence. Esther listened attentively in silence, waiting until you finished before asking further questions.

"I can understand why you chose to remain male. Why'd you choose the other-you to be a woman?"

"Well, I was kind of curious what I'd look like."

"And if I turned out to be some kind of murderous psycho, you figured your odds would be better if you had fifty pounds on me." You involuntarily flinched when she pointed that out. "Don't be that shocked; we're roughly the same person. I'd have tried something similar."

Esther crumpled the empty soda can in her hand before tossing it in the recycle bin. She leaned back against the counter as she looked you up and down. "Well, I'm virtually convinced you're being honest. I'll need a DNA test before I can say a hundred percent, but I am inclined to think you're telling the truth. Or we're both f@#$ing nuts, either or. Now, the next question is: what happens now?"

That... was actually a very good question. You technically didn't exist in this world. In all likelihood, all the id's in your wallet were worthless. You'd need a job, but could you even get one? Did you even count as being educated in this world? Where would you live? Christ, what would you do next?

Esther, seeing the signs of panic setting in (you really needed to work on your poker face), interjected before your emotions could spiral out of control. "Okay, calm down, boy. Jesus, nice to know male-me never got out of nervous teenager mode. First off, do you have any money on you?"

"Yeah, I've got a few hundred bucks on me," you answer.

"Good. Then for now, you'll live with me. I'm not sure what your plans were, but I'm going back to college starting next week. My room mate Daniella bailed on me yesterday; you moving in saves me hunting for a new one. You'll need a job to pay for your half of the rent, but we'll worry about that later. I just came to town to grab the last of my stuff. We'll hit up a Wally World before we hit the road so you can grab some extra clothes and toothbrush and the like. Sound good?"

"That sounds amazing. Thank you!" You had to restrain yourself from hugging... yourself. This was going to get terribly confusing.

Esther laughed. "Don't thank me yet. My couch is harder then a concrete floor. Now c'mon. You can help me carry some boxes down to my car. And let's hurry up; I'd really rather not have to explain you to Mom and Dad right now."

******

Street lights passed over the small car in streaks as the pair of you made your way down the interstate. You'd managed to pack up and do your shopping without incident, and Esther turned her car towards her college home about quarter to six.

Granted, she had failed to mention it was a six hour drive beforehand, but you were hardly in a position to complain.

The two of you had talked for a fair bit of the drive. While most of your lives were the same, certain details were off. For example, while both you were skilled academically, Esther was considerably more physically active, having played basketball in high school and regularly hitting the gym. By contrast, you hadn't played a single sport in school, being far too worried about looking like an idiot in front of others, and generally only went to the gym by accident.

Your paths in college were drastically different as well. While you were both drop outs, Esther had told her (your?) parents considerably sooner then you did. Rather then rack up failed courses and debt like you had, Esther had gone home and worked for a couple years to get her head on straight, and now was ready to give it another go.

You wouldn't say it out loud, but you were a little annoyed that your female-self seemed a lot more mature then you were.

By this point, it was fairly close to midnight, and the well of conversation had dried up as fatigue set in. As you traveled in silence, you looked over the female version of yourself. You hadn't been lying when you said you were curious about what you'd look like as a woman, and if you were stuck here, you might as well take a gander.

Honestly, and at the risk of sounding narcissistic, you were a pretty good looking woman. Esther had an elfin face with a delicate, symmetrical structure. She kept her wavy blond hair cut to chin length, and her blue eyes seemed to sparkle. While you had matching features, though with a considerably more masculine overtone, you'd always felt they were somewhat out of place on you. On her, they just seemed to work.

There was one particular area where Esther really stood out, however.
12123.title: To Tell a Bad Joke

121231.content:
"God almighty, I am one seriously stacked woman! Seriously, God damn!"

There really was no other way to put it. Esther, the female You, was unquestionably one of bustiest women you'd ever seen. She'd set her seat a good ways back to avoid hitting her tits with the steering wheel. The seat belt had been fed between them of necessity, pulling her blouse tight over her bounteous bosom, her bra visible through the strained material and dreadfully little left to the imagination. She'd undone the top couple of buttons on her blouse to keep it from digging into her throat, leaving precious inches of creamy white skin on display. The sheer size of her breasts meant her upper arms were constantly jostling and pressing into the copious amounts of silky flesh. Combining that with the gelatinous jiggle that passed through them with every bump in the road resulted in a ripple effect that was almost hypnotic.

It took far more effort then you cared to admit to look away from that sight. "Seriously, man, get it together! She is literally you! That is a special kind of wrong!"

You didn't doubt for a second which side of the family she/you had gotten it from. Your Mom's side had generally been well endowed, usually C's and D's, though a few woman had reached larger sizes. Esther, though, had breached a whole 'nother category. You couldn't even fathom a guess as to what her cup size actually was, though if her bras had been labelled "Unbelievably Huge," you wouldn't have been terribly surprised.

"Wonder how Melody took this?" you thought. Where you/Esther took after your Mom, Melody had taken after your Dad's side. She had grown into a rather petite girl with bright red hair, perpetually stuck at a B. It had always irked her that her maternal cousins were bustier then she was, especially given the age gap between them, so her reaction to her older sister's giga-bust must have been spectacular.

You made it a particular point not to look at Esther's body the rest of the trip. Seriously, this was getting uncomfortable, and Heaven forbid you get caught staring at... well, yourself.
121231.title: "Back Problems"

1212312.content:
"Chuck. Hey, Chuck."

A voice echoed at the edge of your thoughts, trying and failing to wake you from your slumber. The hand on your shoulder succeeded where the voice had failed, and you opened your eyes. Staring back at you was a pretty blonde face that looked rather familiar...

"So I wasn't dreaming all this."

Esther snorted. "Nope, you definitely weren't. We're here. Grab a box and let's get in. I could sleep for a week."

Here, in this case, was a townhouse in a small suburb. Honestly, there wasn't that much to differentiate this place from all the others around it, although maybe it was more recognizable in daylight. The front lawn was nearly microscopic, and the front of the house was nearly all gone to the driveway and garage. As you exited the car, a light turned on as you activated its motion sensor, helping with the darkness somewhat.

Meeting Esther around the back of the car, you shifted awkwardly as she thrust a box stuffed full of kitchen utensils into your arms. Smiling an apology at you, she stacked the last couple of boxes up and heaved them towards the door. You took a moment to shoulder the duffel bag you'd purchased and filled with your newfound stuff, then hurried forward to help Esther with her boxes.

After a moment fumbling with her keys, she opened the door to the beeping of the alarm. She quickly keyed in the code, which you promptly noticed was your birth year ("I'll have to convince her that's a bad idea."), and the alarm fell silent. "Just stack the boxes in the kitchen for now. I'll get the last ones from the car and lock it up."

In short order, everything of importance was inside and you collapsed on the couch. "God, I'm tired."

You flinched as a pillow and blanket landed on your face. "Thanks," you muttered as you arranged your impromptu bed. You learned much to your chagrin that Esther wasn't kidding about the couch. You were pretty sure there were wooden boards with more give then these cushions, but beggars can't be choosers.

As you arranged your bunk, Esther gave you the quick rundown of the place. "There's a two piece bath on this floor, and a full sized one upstairs. Both bedrooms are on the second floor. Once you have the money for it, we'll set you up in the other bedroom. There's also the suite downstairs, if that's more to your liking, though I was planning to rent that out. Washer and dryer are also in the basement. There's a deep freeze in the garage. It's kind of used for storage; not sure there's enough space to squeeze my car in there."

"Sounds good. Thanks for all this."

"It's not a problem."

"No, I really mean it." You stopped making your bed to look her in the eyes. "Thank you."

She smiled broadly, with a slight blush upon her cheeks, humbled by your heartfelt thanks. "It has been an odd day, hasn't it?"

Now it was your turn to snort. "Odd doesn't begin to describe this day." You laid back on the couch before continuing, "And all I was trying to do was fix a printer."

"What?"

"Didn't I tell you that? I only called that number because I couldn't get my old printer to connect with my laptop. There was a card with that number on it, no other info, in the printer box. Thought it might be the company's help line, so I called them and got the people who sent me here."

"You mean to tell me you got sent to a parallel universe because of a misdial?"

After a brief pause, you both succumb to a giggle fit. Once you caught your breath, you said, "I must be tired if I find that this funny."

"Please, you don't get to say you're tired. You slept the whole way here while I drove."

"Hey, I only dozed for the last half hour, at most."

"Sure, sure. Keep telling yourself that. Anyway, I'm hitting the hay." Esther turned and locked the dead bolt for the front door, then pressed the alarm button on the security system. She turned to walk up the stairs, shouting over her shoulder, "Don't open that without disabling the alarm first. Night!"

"Esther!" You shout after her. She stopped halfway up the stairs and turned around, midway through opening some more buttons on her blouse. "Thanks again!"

"Stop that! You're going to give me a complex. Now go to sleep, dumb ass! We got a lot to do in a week. Now, good night!"

And with that, Esther went upstairs and closed her bedroom door. Left alone in the living room, you doffed your shirt, pants and socks, and laid down under your blanket. Despite your stiff, lumpy bedding, you soon found yourself drifting off to sleep...
1212312.title: Well after midnight

12123121.content:
You were quietly sipping your coffee when you heard Esther coming down the stairs. She stepped into the kitchen, bleary eyed and half awake, dressed in a pink tank top and a pair of black sweats.

As she opened the cupboard over the sink, you said, "Coffee's on the table."

She jumped a little, and spying the source of all happiness already poured for her, came and joined you at the table. She took an appreciative sip of her morning caffeine fix.

"Mmm! How'd you know how I like my coffee?"

You stared at her in silence. A moment later, she closed her eyes as realization came to her. "It's not my fault. I'm not yet awake."

"I can tell," you said, taking a swallow from your mug.

Esther looked over at the newspaper article you were reading. "The Classifieds?"

You nodded. "I didn't have your wifi password, so I walked to the gas station and bought a paper. Figured I could at least see what jobs were available. Course, I still need to figure out if I can even get legal work without a valid social insurance number. Or how hard it would be to apply for one, or something."

Esther rubbed her head. You could almost hear her thinking, "it's way too early in the morning for such heavy thoughts." "Where's your wallet?"

Esther was already in motion by the time you answered, "Over there." Bringing it over to the kitchen table, she started pulling out and arranging your id's. You noticed her frown as she was looking at them.

"What?"

"Hang on a sec," she answered as she grabbed her purse off the floor. Taking her own wallet out, she laid out her own cards alongside yours. As expected, your plastic was nearly identical, minus the being-a-woman part. As you looked closer, you started to see what Female-You had already noticed. "Are these all off by a number?"

"Yes," she nodded, "yes they are."

Sure enough, every single card both of you shared was off by a single digit. License, debit card, social insurance card, everyone. Struck with the same thought, you both pulled out your cellphones and confirmed that even your phone numbers were off by one.

"Well, that is just f@#$ing weird." You weren't sure which one of you said it first.

"Still," you pondered aloud. "This could work. I mean, this means my id's might actually be valid in this world. Right?"

"I have no idea, but there seems to be more hope for that then I thought there was." Esther freshened up your cup before claiming the last of the coffee for herself. "Whose your cellphone provider?"

"Run-Fast."

"That'll probably be your first step, then. Call them, tell them you moved, get your bill coming here." Esther leaned over and grabbed one of her bills off the counter. "Here's the address."

"What if they ask for my old address? If my phone number is off yours, my old address may not have been our parents' house."

Esther looked over your id's, and seeing what she expected, smiled. "Check your license," she said, stabbing a finger at the card before getting up and grabbing a yogurt from the fridge.

You read the address on the card. "Florida!? I've never even been to Florida!"

"Apparently, you have. You should really get that memory loss checked out. There's no way that's healthy."

You looked over the various cards in front of you. You pointed at your SIN card. "Then there's the second step. What are the odds that works?"

"As good as they were the first time you asked me. Seriously, I don't know. Government offices aren't open on the weekend anyway. You won't be able to call them until Monday."

As Esther took a bite of her yogurt, you said, "You know, you could have grabbed me an orange or something."

"I figured if you really wanted one, you'd grab it yourself." Grumbling a little, you got up to grab something from the fridge. You could almost hear the cute smirk on her face as she said, "And as long as you're up..."

"Oh, bite me."

"You wish. You could never afford my rates."

"Foul Temptress," you said, sitting down as she stifled a laugh. Her mood sobered a little. "Seriously, though, I'm more then 62% sure that your SIN will be good. There's just one final piece of the "Won't Die Homeless" puzzle to work out."

"Education," you answered. "Do I have my high school certification in this world, or am I going to need to get my GED? Christ, I don't even know where to start with that one."

"Florida, obviously."

You rubbed your nose in irritation. "Seriously, why Florida?"

"Maybe someone at that office has a wicked sense of humor."

"They're evil, I'll give them that." You leaned back in your chair. "It's seriously the only way to explain what you look like."

"Wait, was that out loud, or in my head?"

"What's that supposed to mean?"

"Well, shit."
12123121.title: The next morning

choices: And now for something completely different
121231211.content:
"Oh God... *gasp, pant* I'm dying..."

"Oh, you big baby. We've only gone six blocks."

"Just leave me where I drop." With those words, you laid down on the ground, gasping for air.

"You're the one who said you wanted to get in better shape. Well, guess what? This is how you do it." Esther, quite infuriatingly, hadn't even broken a sweat. She was standing over top of your prostrate form, arms akimbo, dressed in a tight pair of leggings that did wonders for her figure and what had to be the biggest sports bra you'd ever seen, barely covered by a white spaghetti-strap tank top.

"Still technically you, dude. Quit checking her out."

"I don't *gasp* recall *pant, gasp* saying that."

"Yeah, you did," Esther said as your mind wandered back to about an hour ago...

*** *** ***

You thought about lying to her, or back tracking what you said, but quickly realized that telling her the truth was the best recourse. Even in the off chance your lie would work, she deserved better then that. I mean, she is you, after all.

"Look, it's just... I mean... okay, look, you are gorgeous, alright? A total babe. You are probably the hottest, sexiest, most beautiful woman I've ever seen. If I'd met you in my world, I'd have pined for you forever, so the fact that you're just super-hot woman-me with gloriously massive, gigantic tits is just, you know, totally evil of them. You're magnificent, a literal Aphrodite, and I look in the mirror and think: derp!"

Esther stared at you in silence for awhile, and almost immediately you began to regret laying it on so thick. Just as you were starting to worry, she at last spoke.

"You aren't derpy."

You snorted a little. "Oh yes, I am. My hair's unruly, my face in plain, I'm totally out of shape and I've got no post-secondary. Or maybe not even that, in this world."

"God, give yourself some credit. You're cute." You went to deny it, but Esther held up her hand, forestalling anything you wished to say. "No, I mean it. You're seriously a cute dude. Stop using your hair to hide your face and grow it out a bit more. Trust me, you'll look good with long hair. Buy a brush, cut any split ends, and starting shampooing twice when you shower. Since you're me, I can tell you that you're hair is pretty oily. It'll need it.

Can't help with the education thing, but I can certainly whip you into shape. Trust me, you're already cute. If you start taking better care of your hair, get some muscles on ya, and work on your self-esteem, you'll go from cute to hot, then you'll be beating women off with a stick."

Esther had gotten up from her seat while talking and now stood before you. She slapped a hand down on your shoulder and leaned forward, forcing you to crane your neck to look her in the face, or stare down a literal canyon of cleavage. With her pretty face only a few inches from yours, she said, "Now, get dressed. Me and my gloriously massive, gigantic tits are taking you for a run."

*** *** ***

"Oh c'mon! That's not what I meant!"

"It was strongly implied. Exercise is good for you anyway, so stop being lazy and let's keep going."

"How are you not dying right now?" you said, gasping as you slowly sat up.

"Unlike you, I've done something other then sit on my butt in front of the TV for the last several years. You'll get used to it pretty quickly."

"Oh God, this isn't a one time thing!?"

"Nope," Esther said, holding out a hand to help you up. "If you actually want to BE in some kind of shape, you have to work at it. And before you try to come up with some other way to weasel out of it, you can't job hunt until you get your SIN squared away on Monday. Same goes for finding out if you're educated or not."

When you just ignored the proffered hand and remained sitting, Esther leaned forward. "And getting in shape will help a bit with your rather defeatist attitude. Before you've even spoke to a girl, you've already figured she'll reject you. You've lost the battle before it was even fought. Same with college, I'll bet."

"What do you think you know about me?"

"A lot, given I. Am. You. Your speech also gave a bit of it away. "Pined forever"? Seriously? You out and out stated that you'd never even have attempted to speak to me if we'd met under other circumstances, and that is just wrong. You're never going to knock one out of the park if you don't take a swing.

Also, some women would have been weirded out by that speech, though being called Aphrodite sure did wonders for my ego." At that point, Esther pulled down the front of her shirt with a pair of fingers, once more exposing a whopping amount of cleavage scant inches from your face.

Leaving you stunned on the ground, Esther turned and started to run away. She called over her shoulder, "Now come on! Only four more blocks to go!"

Without another word of complaint, you got to your feet and followed after your female counterpart.
121231211.title: Be Honest

choices: Tell her about your family and house
Tell her about your friends and school life
Check under the floor mat in front of her door
1213.content:
As you finished explaining, she looked at you curiously. Slowly, she approached you, smirking. “You know, now that you mention it....” she started, looking you up and down. However, a sudden knee to the groin dropped you to your knees, shock filling your body. “You must be some kind of idiot if you think I’d believe something like that! Don’t worry, I’m sure there is a nice padded cell for you!” she yelled, quickly turning back toward the house and rushing in toward her bedroom.

Oh crap! No no no! you screamed in your head, quickly pulling yourself up and rushing after her, pain shooting through you all the while. As you rushed into the house, your mind went through a loop, looking identical to the one you left just moments ago. However, the girl’s rushed running up the stairs quickly snapped you out of it, your pace increasing as you launched yourself up the stairs. Just as your were about to grab ahold of her,, your chase came to a sudden stop as your face met the hard wood of her bedroom door, the sound of a lock sealing her inside.

This was it, you had no way of stopping her, the sound of frantic phone dialing sounding off. There was only one thing you could do. As loudly as possible, you call to her, “Please, just listen to me! I know this all sounds crazy, but I’m telling you the truth. Just let me prove it to you. If you were in my situation, I would at least give you a chance.” Just as you heard the last number pushed on the phone, your heart sank as you waited for the inevitable sound of the call tone. However, it didn’t go off. Through the door, you could hear a deep breath and cautious movement as she moved near the door.

“Ok, let’s say I do believe you, that you were right just now. What could you possibly tell me to prove you really are an alternate me?”

As you sit just on the other side of her door, you have to rack your brain now. What could prove this to her?
1213.title: Welp, time to do things the hard way

choices: Their realities are very similar, only a few things changing
Things are drastically different, only the core elements being the same
12133.content:
As you think helplessly what could possibly prove that both of you were the same, you felt the rough floor mat she had in front of her door. You couldn’t help but chuckle as you saw it had the same image of a play station controller on it. Then, sudden realization sparked inside your head.

“Ok, so since we are the same person, that means we have the same floor mat in front of our room. And under said floor mat, we keep a certain thing in case our little sister locks herself in our room.” You reach under the floor mat and find the little cut out in the floor, flipping it up and finding your key buried inside. With a familiar cling and turn, the lock of the door opened, your twin sitting just on the other side. Her face looked in shock as you sat just outside, key in hand. “Our room key, hidden under the trap door we made after she kept locking us out. Enough evidence for you?”

Still in shock, she let out a stream of gasps and stutters, shaking her head as she tried to to wrap her head around all of this. Slowly, you began inching closer to her, placing a hand on her shoulder. “And let me guess, when you were younger your dad sat here just like this out on the playground after you had ran into a pole running away from some bullies, right? He said that you’d never have to feel in threat of those troublemakers anymore, getting them expelled the very next day.” Her eyes pierced through you as she looked in disbelief. She stared to tear up at the corners of her eyes, falling into your arms and slumping over your shoulder. She let out a few chuckles, wiping her eyes.

“You...you either really are me or you have a sick skill of mind reading.” She fell back onto her knees, smiling ever so lightly.

“I’d say probably the first of the two, although I definitely wouldn’t mind having mind reading powers.”

She burst out laughing and fell onto her back, wiping away tears that formed uncontrollably. Giggling, you joined her, laying next to her and looking up at the ceiling. “Hahaha, that’s something only I would say. You definitely are me”

“Well no duh Sherlock, it’s not like I have been saying it since I got here only five minutes ago.”

She turned to you and gave your arm a sharp punch, laughing all the while. “Hey, how was I supposed to know? Being another me, would you really trust someone who said they were from another reality?”

“Haha, I guess not. Although that does make me question, how similar are we really?”
12133.title: Some things never change

13.content:
"...you are male, correct?"

"Yeah, so what?"

"And you wish to be female, right?"

"Yeah. I'm curious."

"...well then, as long as you know, sir... or should I say, madam. The transportation shall begin in 3... 2... 1... No-"

The voice was cut off as you are suddenly thrown into a wormhole, destroying any sense of... anything that you were just feeling. You realise now that your parents would definitely be wondering where there son went. Especially if one of them saw you holding a phone one minute, and flying through reality the next.

Unfortunately, you couldn't really dwell on this for much longer, as your body (which, you just realised, was naked. Who designed this? you wonder, as you try to cover up your penis.) was changing. You could feel it becoming curvier, smoother and lighter. Well, as much as you could measure lightness while you were flying through a rip in the world.

You felt your penis start to shrink. Not just going limp, but actually shrinking, going back into your body. You felt this area being completely changed into a completely female vagina.

Simultaneously, you were feeling breasts grow on your chest, probably around a C cup size. You had your arms still covering your (now female) private parts, so the sudden feeling of flesh on your arms caused you to gasp slightly.

You realised that your voice had been changed as well. Whereas before, it was deep (many of your friends wondered how your voice could go that low), now it was fairly high. You decided to test it out.

"He-"

Even knowing your voice was a woman's, it was still startling.

"Hello, I'm..."

Realising that a male name wouldn't really suit you, you decided to take a female one. Since none were going through your head at the moment, the decision was left for later.

You realised that while you were playing with your voice, your arms and legs had been altered. They were completely smooth, not a trace of hair anywhere. Your feet looked incredibly cute to you (Cute? Where did that come from? you wonder) and currently had red nail polish, which, you realised, was on your hands as well.

You only noticed that you head was changed when a mirror suddenly started flying alongside you (your immediate thought was, WTF?) and showed you. It looked younger than your head, but definitely suited your body. Your long hair, currently tying itself into a ponytail, was shining black and, when it finished tying itself and you brought it down to feel it, smelt strangely like apple.

Had you been paying any attention to your surroundings, you would have noticed a projection of what happened after your call. Somehow, an exact copy of you was standing at the phone, sighing and putting it back.It then walked off into another part of the house. You caught this last part, though, and that was enough to convince you of what was going on back in your world. To them, it probably never happened, you thought.

The mirror next to you disappeared as you suddenly stood in the backyard of your house. However, the sudden shift from flying and not really feeling anything caused you to immediately lose balance, and fall.

While on the soft grass, you looked down to see if you were still naked. You weren't luckily, and slowly stood up. But you fell back down again when a loud voice rang through your mind.

Transportation complete.

You were still lying on the ground, now quite nervous, when someone opened the back door. It was...

14.title: Female/Female

choices: She gives you a slutty outfit
She gives you a girly outfit
141.content:
You see a girl that looks exatly like you did in the mirror.

"Whats going on?" she asks

You explain what happens, and oddly she believes you,

"I just got the same call, I turned down the offer, i guess you accepted it, and now your here, thats awesome I've always wanted a twin sister, and you say you were a boy, I'll teach you all about being a girl, C'mon up to my room, lets play dress-up!"
141.title: Alternate you

142.content: Is it your brother or sister?
142.title: Alternate Sibling

info.brief_description: Live with an alternate version of yourself.
info.description:
After dialing a number to a strange company, you are whisked away to anothr universe that is almost the same as yours...
with a few exceptions.

Rules:
No bad grammar/excessive spelling errors. One or two are fine.
Don't shorten words unless it fits in with the context. (eg. no plz, unless it's part of a text message or something)
No blowing up the world just because reality was broken. That's no fun.

Notes:
Italics is used to show a person is thinking.
The alternate universe will be exactly the same as yours, except that there will be two of you, or a male and female version of yourself living in the same universe.
Whether there is a way to get back to your own universe or not is basically up to you.

This section will update if necessary.
